aws_rds_iam_auth.description: Use rds_iam instead of password authentication (see: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/UsingWithRDS.IAMDBAuth.html)

aws_rds_iam_profile.description: AWS profile to use for IAM auth

aws_rds_iam_region.description: AWS region to use for IAM auth

azure_identity_auth.description: Use MS Azure identity OAuth token (see: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/postgresql/flexible-server/how-to-configure-sign-in-azure-ad-authentication)

connect_timeout.description: Maximum wait for connection, in seconds. Zero or not specified means wait indefinitely.

database.description: The name of the database to connect to in order to conenct to (defaults to `postgres`).

database_username.description: Database username associated to the connected user (for user name maps)

expected_version.description: Specify the expected version of PostgreSQL.

host.description: Name of PostgreSQL server address to connect to

max_connections.description: Maximum number of connections to establish to the database. Zero means unlimited.

password.description: Password to be used if the PostgreSQL server demands password authentication

port.description: The PostgreSQL port number to connect to at the server host, or socket file name extension for Unix-domain connections

sslmode.description: This option determines whether or with what priority a secure SSL TCP/IP connection will be negotiated with the PostgreSQL server

sslrootcert.description: The SSL server root certificate file path. The file must contain PEM encoded data.

superuser.description: Specify if the user to connect as is a Postgres superuser or not.If not, some feature might be disabled (e.g.: Refreshing state password from Postgres)

username.description: PostgreSQL user name to connect as

cert.description: The SSL client certificate file path. The file must contain PEM encoded data.

key.description: The SSL client certificate private key file path. The file must contain PEM encoded data.

sslinline.description: Must be set to true if you are inlining the cert/key instead of using a file path.

block.description: SSL client certificate if required by the database.

allow_connections.description: If false then no one can connect to this database

connection_limit.description: How many concurrent connections can be made to this database

encoding.description: Character set encoding to use in the new database

is_template.description: If true, then this database can be cloned by any user with CREATEDB privileges

lc_collate.description: Collation order (LC_COLLATE) to use in the new database

lc_ctype.description: Character classification (LC_CTYPE) to use in the new database

name.description: The PostgreSQL database name to connect to

owner.description: The ROLE which owns the database

tablespace_name.description: The name of the tablespace that will be associated with the new database

template.description: The name of the template from which to create the new database

database.description: The database to grant default privileges for this role

object_type.description: The PostgreSQL object type to set the default privileges on (one of: table, sequence, function, type, schema)

owner.description: Target role for which to alter default privileges.

privileges.description: The list of privileges to apply as default privileges

role.description: The name of the role to which grant default privileges on

schema.description: The database schema to set default privileges for this role

with_grant_option.description: Permit the grant recipient to grant it to others

create_cascade.description: When true, will also create any extensions that this extension depends on that are not already installed

database.description: Sets the database to add the extension to

drop_cascade.description: When true, will also drop all the objects that depend on the extension, and in turn all objects that depend on those objects

schema.description: Sets the schema of an extension

version.description: Sets the version number of the extension

database.description: The database where the function is located. If not specified, the provider default database is used.

drop_cascade.description: Automatically drop objects that depend on the function (such as operators or triggers), and in turn all objects that depend on those objects.

language.description: Language of theof the function. One of: internal, sql, c, plpgsql

parallel.description: If the function can be executed in parallel for a single query execution. One of: UNSAFE, RESTRICTED, SAFE

returns.description: Function return type. If not specified, it will be calculated based on the output arguments

schema.description: Schema where the function is located. If not specified, the provider default schema is used.

security_definer.description: If the function should execute with the permissions of the function owner instead of the permissions of the caller.

strict.description: If the function should always return NULL if any of it's inputs is NULL.

volatility.description: Volatility of the function. One of: VOLATILE, STABLE, IMMUTABLE.

default.description: An expression to be used as default value if the parameter is not specified.

mode.description: The argument mode. One of: IN, OUT, INOUT, or VARIADIC

name.description: The argument name. The name may be required for some languages or depending on the argument mode.

columns.description: The specific columns to grant privileges on for this role

database.description: The database to grant privileges on for this role

object_type.description: The PostgreSQL object type to grant the privileges on (one of: database, function, procedure, routine, schema, sequence, table, foreign_data_wrapper, foreign_server, column)

objects.description: The specific objects to grant privileges on for this role (empty means all objects of the requested type)

privileges.description: The list of privileges to grant

role.description: The name of the role to grant privileges on

schema.description: The database schema to grant privileges on for this role

with_grant_option.description: Permit the grant recipient to grant it to others

grant_role.description: The name of the role that is granted to role

role.description: The name of the role to grant grant_role

with_admin_option.description: Permit the grant recipient to grant it to others

all_tables.description: Sets the tables list to publish to ALL tables

database.description: Sets the database to add the publication for

drop_cascade.description: When true, will also drop all the objects that depend on the publication, and in turn all objects that depend on those objects

owner.description: Sets the owner of the publication

publish_param.description: Sets which DML operations will be published

publish_via_partition_root_param.description: Sets whether changes in a partitioned table using the identity and schema of the partitioned table

tables.description: Sets the tables list to publish

database.description: Sets the database to add the replication slot to

plugin.description: Sets the output plugin to use

assume_role.description: Role to switch to at login

bypass_row_level_security.description: Determine whether a role bypasses every row-level security (RLS) policy

connection_limit.description: How many concurrent connections can be made with this role

create_database.description: Define a role's ability to create databases

create_role.description: Determine whether this role will be permitted to create new roles

encrypted_password.description: Control whether the password is stored encrypted in the system catalogs

idle_in_transaction_session_timeout.description: Terminate any session with an open transaction that has been idle for longer than the specified duration in milliseconds

inherit.description: Determine whether a role "inherits" the privileges of roles it is a member of

login.description: Determine whether a role is allowed to log in

replication.description: Determine whether a role is allowed to initiate streaming replication or put the system in and out of backup mode

roles.description: Role(s) to grant to this new role

skip_drop_role.description: Skip actually running the DROP ROLE command when removing a ROLE from PostgreSQL

skip_reassign_owned.description: Skip actually running the REASSIGN OWNED command when removing a role from PostgreSQL

statement_timeout.description: Abort any statement that takes more than the specified number of milliseconds

superuser.description: Determine whether the new role is a "superuser"

valid_until.description: Sets a date and time after which the role's password is no longer valid

database.description: The database name to alter schema

drop_cascade.description: When true, will also drop all the objects that are contained in the schema

if_not_exists.description: When true, use the existing schema if it exists

owner.description: The ROLE name who owns the schema

create.description: If true, allow the specified ROLEs to CREATE new objects within the schema(s)

create_with_grant.description: If true, allow the specified ROLEs to CREATE new objects within the schema(s) and GRANT the same CREATE privilege to different ROLEs

role.description: ROLE who will receive this policy (default: PUBLIC)

usage.description: If true, allow the specified ROLEs to use objects within the schema(s)

usage_with_grant.description: If true, allow the specified ROLEs to use objects within the schema(s) and GRANT the same USAGE privilege to different ROLEs

drop_cascade.description: Automatically drop objects that depend on the server (such as user mappings), and in turn all objects that depend on those objects. Drop RESTRICT is the default

fdw_name.description: The name of the foreign-data wrapper that manages the server

options.description: This clause specifies the options for the server. The options typically define the connection details of the server, but the actual names and values are dependent on the server's foreign-data wrapper

server_name.description: The name of the foreign server to be created

server_owner.description: The user name of the new owner of the foreign server

server_type.description: Optional server type, potentially useful to foreign-data wrappers

server_version.description: Optional server version, potentially useful to foreign-data wrappers.

conninfo.description: The connection string to the publisher. It should follow the keyword/value format (https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-connect.html#LIBPQ-CONNSTRING)

create_slot.description: Specifies whether the command should create the replication slot on the publisher

database.description: Sets the database to add the subscription for

publications.description: Names of the publications on the publisher to subscribe to

slot_name.description: Name of the replication slot to use. The default behavior is to use the name of the subscription for the slot name

options.description: This clause specifies the options of the user mapping. The options typically define the actual user name and password of the mapping. Option names must be unique. The allowed option names and values are specific to the server's foreign-data wrapper

server_name.description: The name of an existing server for which the user mapping is to be created

user_name.description: The name of an existing user that is mapped to foreign server. CURRENT_ROLE, CURRENT_USER, and USER match the name of the current user. When PUBLIC is specified, a so-called public mapping is created that is used when no user-specific mapping is applicable

database.description: The PostgreSQL database which will be queried for schema names

include_system_schemas.description: Determines whether to include system schemas (pg_ prefix and information_schema). 'public' will always be included.

like_all_patterns.description: Expression(s) which will be pattern matched in the query using the PostgreSQL LIKE ALL operator

like_any_patterns.description: Expression(s) which will be pattern matched in the query using the PostgreSQL LIKE ANY operator

not_like_all_patterns.description: Expression(s) which will be pattern matched in the query using the PostgreSQL NOT LIKE ALL operator

regex_pattern.description: Expression which will be pattern matched in the query using the PostgreSQL ~ (regular expression match) operator

schemas.description: The list of PostgreSQL schemas retrieved by this data source

database.description: The PostgreSQL database which will be queried for sequence names

like_all_patterns.description: Expression(s) which will be pattern matched against sequence names in the query using the PostgreSQL LIKE ALL operator

like_any_patterns.description: Expression(s) which will be pattern matched against sequence names in the query using the PostgreSQL LIKE ANY operator

not_like_all_patterns.description: Expression(s) which will be pattern matched against sequence names in the query using the PostgreSQL NOT LIKE ALL operator

regex_pattern.description: Expression which will be pattern matched against sequence names in the query using the PostgreSQL ~ (regular expression match) operator

schemas.description: The PostgreSQL schema(s) which will be queried for sequence names. Queries all schemas in the database by default

sequences.description: The list of PostgreSQL sequence names retrieved by this data source. Note that this returns a set, so duplicate table names across different schemas will be consolidated.

database.description: The PostgreSQL database which will be queried for table names

like_all_patterns.description: Expression(s) which will be pattern matched against table names in the query using the PostgreSQL LIKE ALL operator

like_any_patterns.description: Expression(s) which will be pattern matched against table names in the query using the PostgreSQL LIKE ANY operator

not_like_all_patterns.description: Expression(s) which will be pattern matched against table names in the query using the PostgreSQL NOT LIKE ALL operator

regex_pattern.description: Expression which will be pattern matched against table names in the query using the PostgreSQL ~ (regular expression match) operator

schemas.description: The PostgreSQL schema(s) which will be queried for table names. Queries all schemas in the database by default

table_types.description: The PostgreSQL table types which will be queried for table names. Includes all table types by default. Use 'BASE TABLE' for normal tables only

tables.description: The list of PostgreSQL tables retrieved by this data source. Note that this returns a set, so duplicate table names across different schemas will be consolidated.
